intro: Oenothera muricata var. canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf evening primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its medicinal properties, particularly its seeds rich in essential fatty acids. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique flowering pattern and adaptability make it a notable species in xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
